data.title: Lovely restaurant, average food
data.text: I really wanted the food to reflect the physical restaurant, which is roomy and nice. Alas, the food is rather average. Still it's a good place to hang out with friends.

data.title: a lovely space to work
data.text: the layout is beautiful, with huge windows.  i go there at the end of the semester with my teaching assistants to grade final exams.  unfortunately, there's nothing for me to eat there, no vegan options.  i find this perplexing, considering that this is california.  also, the drinks are overpriced.

data.title: Great Gluten Free Cookies
data.text:
I can't rave enough on how delicious their gluten free cookies taste, with peanut butter being my favorite. If anyone with gluten allergies know coming across a good tasting treat is very challenging. 

My daughter had the Lemon Chantilly Crepe cake and she was very satisfied with the taste.

They have a wonderful selection of desserts along with sandwiches, coffee, tea and other menu selections. It's nice and open with lots of seating.  Great place to meet up at.

data.title: Excellent gourmet bakery
data.text: This bakery cafe has very high end cakes, cupcakes, cookies, ice cream, and breakfast and lunch food.  The baked goods look like works of art and taste wonderful.  If you are in downtown Fullerton, treat yourself.

data.title: Needs spice
data.text:
A colleague and I stopped at Bolu to purchase cookie gift packs for clients.

The desserts look so yummy and decadent! 

As it was lunch time we decided to try their lunch menu, neither of us had been there for bakery or meal items previously.

The environment is rather industrial. Chairs scraping the floors was hard on the ears.

I ordered the pulled pork sandwich. The sandwich is accompanied by cole slaw and chips. Not being a cole slaw fan I specified "no cole slaw", no substitute was suggested or offered. 

When you swipe your credit card the screen has a tip chart. Usually I leave a tip based on service which at that point the service was no different from going to a fast good place and paying at the register. It seemed odd to prepay a tip for nothing different from any fast food joint.

I ordered the pulled pork sandwich. My colleague ordered an open face melted cheese over ham sandwich. Her sandwich had no sides.

The pork on my sandwich had a fair amount of fat and gristle. When I shred my meats I remove the fat and gristle so ended up making a mess of my sandwich as I removed the fat and gristle because it gags me to bite into the gristle. The pork was very tender, the bread was toasted on one side yet very soft and chewy inside. The sandwich was very dry without any condiments. In retrospect the menu simply said pulled pork, I should not have expected a little bar-b-que sauce. I was not alone in expecting some sort of moisture as my colleague looked at the sandwich and commented "shouldn't you have some kind of sauce?"

As they give you a number then drop off your order, just like any fast food place, no one checks back to ask if anything else is needed or if all is fine. In hindsight I could have gone to the register to ask for some kind of condiment, I was just so surprised and we were in a hurry to finish seeing our accounts after waiting a while to receive our meals I didn't think to ask if there might be something I could have added to the sandwich.

The chips were stale.

My sandwich was $12.51 including the prepaid tip. It seemed expensive for stale chips and a dry sandwich.

My colleague didn't comment on her sandwich.

I saw someone with a salad that looked scrumptious. I may try Bolu one more time for a salad. And the bakery though pricey beckons to be sampled.

I'm willing to give it one more try, perhaps it was an "off day" for them.

data.title: Leave room for dessert
data.text: That's what it's all about after all--"bakery" and their macarons in every imaginable color and flavor are a great finale to the meal. But really nice salads, sandwiches and other main dishes prepared to order (service can be on the slow side) are worth the visit too.

data.title: Excellent desserts!
data.text: We stopped here to pick up desserts to take home.  They have a huge selection of sweets, all beautifully displayed.  The items are a bit pricey but very delicious and worth it.  We chose an individual pecan pie, a slice of carrot cake, and three cookies.  All of them were very tasty, and I know we'll go back.

data.title: Interesting Bakery & Cafe
data.text:
I was looking for something sweet to compliment my pastrami sandwich.  Across the street was a surprise called Bolu Bakery & Café.  It serves all three meals with a bigger emphasis on breakfast.  The lunch and dinner menu is smaller with a focus on sandwiches.  This venue is somewhat reminiscent of Starbucks.  Many patrons were working online while grabbing a bite to eat.  

I found a gluten free peanut butter cookie.  I also ordered some ice cream made in store.  I ordered the salted Carmel with some chocolate.  The chocolate was firm and tasted superb.  The taste of the Carmel was as you would expect, but is had softened so much that its texture left me wishing it was as hard as the chocolate.  The cookie was not my favorite, but that likely was due to the gluten free nature.  

The cabinets were full of baked goods all of which were very tempting.  But I will save my figure and perhaps return another time.  This was a unique venue for a quick breakfast or sandwich or someone with a sweet tooth!
